title: Guest Post — The Evolution of the Editorial Office: From Kitchen Tables to Global Infrastructure
content:
Today's guest bloggers discuss how peer review management became a profession and how they are advancing the next chapter together.

The post Guest Post — The Evolution of the Editorial Office: From Kitchen Tables to Global Infrastructure appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Kristen Overstreet, Cara Rivera
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post — Re-imagining Scholarly Integrity: The “Continuum of Consensus” Quality Control System
content:
Today's guest blogger proposes the "Continuum of Consensus" as a solution to shore up research integrity, peer review, and the public trust in scholarly research.

The post Guest Post — Re-imagining Scholarly Integrity: The “Continuum of Consensus” Quality Control System appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Ch. Mahmood Anwar
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post — Diamond Open Access Needs Institutions, Not Heroes
content:
Today's guest blogger asks: What would it mean to support community-led publishing as infrastructure, rather than as a collection of heroic individual efforts?

The post Guest Post — Diamond Open Access Needs Institutions, Not Heroes appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Curt Rice
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: From “AI helps me write” to “AI runs the workflow”: Eight Tech-trend Reports through a Publishing-and-learning Lens
content:
A review of eight technology industry trend reports that offer a similar conclusion: AI is no longer a feature. It’s becoming infrastructure — and the unit of value is moving from “a better tool” to “a better system.”

The post From “AI helps me write” to “AI runs the workflow”: Eight Tech-trend Reports through a Publishing-and-learning Lens appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Hong Zhou
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post: The Human Heart of Science — Navigating AI Anxiety in the Academic World
content:
Today's guest blogger calls for "rehumanizing" our view on AI innovations and their impacts on our mental health and our communities.

The post Guest Post: The Human Heart of Science — Navigating AI Anxiety in the Academic World appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Krishna Kumar Venkitachalam
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post — There’s an Elephant in the Room, but Not in Your Usage Reports
content:
Today's guest bloggers spotlight a gap in traditional usage reporting, third-party AI usage, and recommend steps needed to recover missing usage data.

The post Guest Post — There’s an Elephant in the Room, but Not in Your Usage Reports appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Michelle Urberg, Chris Bendall
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: So… IS the Essence of a Journal Portable? Checking in on _NeuroImage_ and _Imaging Neuroscience_
content:
How are two competing neuroscience journals faring since the editorial board of one departed to create the other?

The post So… IS the Essence of a Journal Portable? Checking in on _NeuroImage_ and _Imaging Neuroscience_ appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Rick Anderson
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing

title: Guest Post — Putting the “U” in FAIR
content:
Today's guest blogger calls for adding "understandable" to the FAIR data principles, to ensure we do not surrender human knowledge in our rush for automation.

The post Guest Post — Putting the “U” in FAIR appeared first on The Scholarly Kitchen.
creator: Jeff Lang
sourceDescription: What’s Hot and Cooking In Scholarly Publishing
